results.title: Sariska Tiger Reserve: Rajasthan: Sariska tigress welcomes 4 cubs, tiger count hits 49 — time to book that safari | - Times of India
results.description: In a boost for wildlife conservation, tigress ST-19 has delivered four cubs in Sariska Tiger Reserve's buffer zone, marking her third litter and raising the reserve's tiger count to 49. This event highlights the success of ongoing conservation efforts, especially after the reserve faced zero ...

results.description: Satpura is counted among the best offbeat tiger safari experiences in India.

results.title: Uttar Pradesh records highest dolphin count in India, 32 more tigers in 4 years
results.description: Uttar Pradesh now has the highest number of dolphins in India, and the state’s tiger population has also grown from 173 in 2018 to 205 in 2022, according to the recent Forest Department report.

results.title: Siberian tiger - Wikipedia
results.description: In 1992 and 1993, the maximum total population density of the Sikhote-Alin tiger population was estimated at 0.62 tigers in 100 km2 (39 sq mi). The maximum adult population estimated in 1993 reached 0.3 tigers in 100 km2 (39 sq mi), with a sex ratio of averaging 2.4 females per male.

results.title: India - Wikipedia
results.description: In response, the system of national parks and protected areas, first established in 1935, was expanded substantially. In 1972, India enacted the Wildlife Protection Act and Project Tiger to safeguard crucial wilderness; the Forest Conservation Act was enacted in 1980 and amendments added in 1988.
